description: Supporters of same-sex marriage chanted “love wins,” while supporters of Kim Davis worried about religious freedom.
title: Outside Courthouse, Kim Davis Is Seen as a Villain and a Hero
title_page: Outside Courthouse, Kim Davis Is Seen as a Villain and a Hero - The New York Times
text:
Outside a federal courthouse in Ashland, Ky., on Thursday, dozens of people gathered in two cacophonous groups to debate what both sides felt was history in the making, but for different reasons.
On one side, there were those condemning the actions of Kim Davis, a clerk of courts in Rowan County whose repeated refusal to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples resulted in a federal judge on Thursday holding her in contempt and jailing her.
“I didn’t have to think about it,” Ms. Davis, an Apostolic Christian, told the court of her religious views. “There was no choice there.”
Her critics saw her jailing as vindication, and as an indication that the final barriers to same-sex marriage were continuing to fall.
